00022 WeBWorK::Utils::DBImportExport - import and export the database.

00026 use strict;
00027 use warnings;
00028 use Carp;
00029 use XML::Parser;
00030 use XML::Parser::EasyTree; $XML::Parser::EasyTree::Noempty = 1;
00031 use XML::Writer;
00032 use WeBWorK::Utils qw();
00033 
00034 our @EXPORT    = ();
00035 our @EXPORT_OK = qw(
00036     listTables
00037     dbExport
00038     dbImport
00039 );
00040 
00041 our $DB_VERSION = "WWDBv2";
00042 
00043 # table order is important
00044 our @TABLE_ORDER = qw/user password permission key set problem set_user problem_user/;
00045 
00046 # each subroutine should take a WeBWorK::DB object and return all records of a
00047 # given type. these are tricky!
00048 #our %EXPORT_SUBS = (
00049 #   user         => sub { $_[0]->getUsers($_[0]->listUsers) },
00050 #   password     => sub { $_[0]->getPasswords($_[0]->listPasswords) },
00051 #   permission   => sub { $_[0]->getPermissionLevels($_[0]->listPermissionLevels) },
00052 #   key          => sub { $_[0]->getKeys($_[0]->listKeys) },
00053 #   set          => sub { $_[0]->getGlobalSets($_[0]->listGlobalSets) },
00054 #   problem      => sub { map { $_[0]->getAllGlobalProblems($_) } $_[0]->listGlobalSets },
00055 #   set_user     => sub { $_[0]->getUserSets( map { my $u=$_; map { [$u, $_] } $_[0]->listUserSets($u) } $_[0]->listUsers ) },
00056 #   problem_user => sub { map { my $u=$_; map { $_[0]->getAllUserProblems($u, $_) } $_[0]->listUserSets($u) } $_[0]->listUsers },
00057 #);
00058 # The above isn't used any more because it was waaay toooo sloowwww...
00059 
00060 # each subroutine should take a WeBWorK::DB object and return a new, empty
00061 # record object for a table.
00062 our %NEW_SUBS = (
00063     user         => sub { $_[0]->newUser },
00064     password     => sub { $_[0]->newPassword },
00065     permission   => sub { $_[0]->newPermissionLevel },
00066     key          => sub { $_[0]->newKey },
00067     set          => sub { $_[0]->newGlobalSet },
00068     problem      => sub { $_[0]->newGlobalProblem },
00069     set_user     => sub { $_[0]->newUserSet },
00070     problem_user => sub { $_[0]->newUserProblem },
00071 );
00072 
00073 # each subroutine should take a WeBWorK::DB object and a subclass of 
00074 # WeBWorK::DB::Record, and should add that record into a table in the given
00075 # database.
00076 our %ADD_SUBS = (
00077     user         => sub { $_[0]->addUser($_[1]) },
00078     password     => sub { $_[0]->addPassword($_[1]) },
00079     permission   => sub { $_[0]->addPermissionLevel($_[1]) },
00080     key          => sub { $_[0]->addKey($_[1]) },
00081     set          => sub { $_[0]->addGlobalSet($_[1]) },
00082     problem      => sub { $_[0]->addGlobalProblem($_[1]) },
00083     set_user     => sub { $_[0]->addUserSet($_[1]) },
00084     problem_user => sub { $_[0]->addUserProblem($_[1]) },
00085 );
00086 
00087 # each subroutine should take a WeBWorK::DB object and a subclass of 
00088 # WeBWorK::DB::Record, and should put that record into a table in the given
00089 # database.
00090 our %PUT_SUBS = (
00091     user         => sub { $_[0]->putUser($_[1]) },
00092     password     => sub { $_[0]->putPassword($_[1]) },
00093     permission   => sub { $_[0]->putPermissionLevel($_[1]) },
00094     key          => sub { $_[0]->putKey($_[1]) },
00095     set          => sub { $_[0]->putGlobalSet($_[1]) },
00096     problem      => sub { $_[0]->putGlobalProblem($_[1]) },
00097     set_user     => sub { $_[0]->putUserSet($_[1]) },
00098     problem_user => sub { $_[0]->putUserProblem($_[1]) },
00099 );

00105 =item listTables()

00107 List the names of the tables supported for export.

00111 sub listTables {
00112     return @TABLE_ORDER;
00113 }
00114 
00115 =item dbExport(%options)
00116 
00117 Exports data from a WeBWorK database to a WWDBv2 XML document.
00118 
00119 %options can contain:
00120 
00121 =over
00122 
00123 =item db
00124 
00125 A WeBWorK::DB instance. Data will be exported from this database.
00126 
00127 =item xml
00128 
00129 A file handle, opened for writing. The XML output will we written to this file
00130 handle.
00131 
00132 =item tables
00133 
00134 A reference to a list specifying the set of tables from which to export data.
00135 
00136 =item records
00137 
00138 Unimplemented.
00139 
00140 =back
00141 
00142 =cut
00143 
00144 # DBFIXME this whole module is a MESS! we need efficient dump/restore functionality in the abstraction layer!
00145 sub dbExport {
00146     my (%options) = @_;
00147     
00148     croak "options: 'xml' required.\n" unless exists $options{xml};
00149     croak "options: 'db' required.\n" unless exists $options{db};
00150     
00151     my @tables = exists $options{tables} ? @{$options{tables}} : ();
00152     @tables = @TABLE_ORDER unless @tables;
00153     my %tables;
00154     @tables{@tables} = ();
00155 
00156     my $writer = new XML::Writer(OUTPUT => $options{xml}, NEWLINES => 0, DATA_MODE => 1);
00157     $writer->startTag("webwork", version => $DB_VERSION);
00158     
00159     #foreach my $table (@TABLE_ORDER) {
00160     #   next unless exists $tables{$table}; # skip unrequested tables
00161     #   $writer->startTag($table."s"); # plural
00162     #   
00163     #   my @Records = $EXPORT_SUBS{$table}->($options{db});
00164     #   foreach my $Record (@Records) {
00165     #       next unless $Record; # skip undefined records
00166     #       $writer->startTag($table);
00167     #       foreach my $field ($Record->FIELDS) {
00168     #           $writer->dataElement($field, $Record->$field);
00169     #       }
00170     #       $writer->endTag;
00171     #   }
00172     #   $writer->endTag;
00173     #   delete $tables{$table}; # finished with that table
00174     #}
00175     
00176     my $db = $options{db};
00177     
00178     if (exists $tables{user}) {
00179         $writer->startTag("users");
00180         my @recordIDs = $db->listUsers;
00181         foreach my $recordID (@recordIDs) {
00182             my $Record = $db->getUser($recordID);
00183             next unless $Record;
00184             $writer->startTag("user");
00185             foreach my $field ($Record->FIELDS) {
00186                 $writer->dataElement($field, $Record->$field);
00187             }
00188             $writer->endTag; # user
00189         }
00190         $writer->endTag; # users
00191         delete $tables{user}; # finished with that table
00192     }
00193     
00194     if (exists $tables{password}) {
00195         $writer->startTag("passwords");
00196         my @recordIDs = $db->listPasswords;
00197         foreach my $recordID (@recordIDs) {
00198             my $Record = $db->getPassword($recordID);
00199             next unless $Record;
00200             $writer->startTag("password");
00201             foreach my $field ($Record->FIELDS) {
00202                 $writer->dataElement($field, $Record->$field);
00203             }
00204             $writer->endTag; # password
00205         }
00206         $writer->endTag; # passwords
00207         delete $tables{password}; # finished with that table
00208     }
00209     
00210     if (exists $tables{permission}) {
00211         $writer->startTag("permissions");
00212         my @recordIDs = $db->listPermissionLevels;
00213         foreach my $recordID (@recordIDs) {
00214             my $Record = $db->getPermissionLevel($recordID);
00215             next unless $Record;
00216             $writer->startTag("permission");
00217             foreach my $field ($Record->FIELDS) {
00218                 $writer->dataElement($field, $Record->$field);
00219             }
00220             $writer->endTag; # permission
00221         }
00222         $writer->endTag; # permissions
00223         delete $tables{permission}; # finished with that table
00224     }
00225     
00226     if (exists $tables{key}) {
00227         $writer->startTag("keys");
00228         my @recordIDs = $db->listKeys;
00229         foreach my $recordID (@recordIDs) {
00230             my $Record = $db->getKey($recordID);
00231             next unless $Record;
00232             $writer->startTag("key");
00233             foreach my $field ($Record->FIELDS) {
00234                 $writer->dataElement($field, $Record->$field);
00235             }
00236             $writer->endTag; # key
00237         }
00238         $writer->endTag; # keys
00239         delete $tables{key}; # finished with that table
00240     }
00241     
00242     if (exists $tables{set}) {
00243         $writer->startTag("sets");
00244         my @recordIDs = $db->listGlobalSets;
00245         foreach my $recordID (@recordIDs) {
00246             my $Record = $db->getGlobalSet($recordID);
00247             next unless $Record;
00248             $writer->startTag("set");
00249             foreach my $field ($Record->FIELDS) {
00250                 $writer->dataElement($field, $Record->$field);
00251             }
00252             $writer->endTag; # set
00253         }
00254         $writer->endTag; # sets
00255         delete $tables{set}; # finished with that table
00256     }
00257     
00258     if (exists $tables{problem}) {
00259         $writer->startTag("problems");
00260         my @setIDs = $db->listGlobalSets;
00261         foreach my $setID (@setIDs) {
00262             # BEGIN old
00263             #my @problemIDs = $db->listGlobalProblems($setID);
00264             #foreach my $problemID (@problemIDs) {
00265             #   my $Record = $db->getGlobalProblem($setID, $problemID);
00266             # END old
00267             # BEGIN new
00268             my @Problems = $db->getAllGlobalProblems($setID);
00269             foreach my $Record (@Problems) {
00270             # END new
00271                 next unless $Record;
00272                 $writer->startTag("problem");
00273                 foreach my $field ($Record->FIELDS) {
00274                     $writer->dataElement($field, $Record->$field);
00275                 }
00276                 $writer->endTag; # problem
00277             }
00278         }
00279         $writer->endTag; # problems
00280         delete $tables{problem}; # finished with that table
00281     }
00282     
00283     if (exists $tables{set_user}) {
00284         $writer->startTag("set_users");
00285         my @userIDs = $db->listUsers;
00286         foreach my $userID (@userIDs) {
00287             my @setIDs = $db->listUserSets($userID);
00288             foreach my $setID (@setIDs) {
00289                 my $Record = $db->getUserSet($userID, $setID);
00290                 next unless $Record;
00291                 $writer->startTag("set_user");
00292                 foreach my $field ($Record->FIELDS) {
00293                     $writer->dataElement($field, $Record->$field);
00294                 }
00295                 $writer->endTag; # set_user
00296             }
00297         }
00298         $writer->endTag; # set_users
00299         delete $tables{set_user}; # finished with that table
00300     }
00301     
00302     if (exists $tables{problem_user}) {
00303         $writer->startTag("problem_users");
00304         my @userIDs = $db->listUsers;
00305         foreach my $userID (@userIDs) {
00306             my @setIDs = $db->listUserSets($userID);
00307             foreach my $setID (@setIDs) {
00308                 # BEGIN old
00309                 #my @problemIDs = $db->listUserProblems($userID, $setID);
00310                 #foreach my $problemID (@problemIDs) {
00311                 #   my $Record = $db->getUserProblem($userID, $setID, $problemID);
00312                 # END old
00313                 # BEGIN new
00314                 my @Problems = $db->getAllUserProblems($userID, $setID);
00315                 foreach my $Record (@Problems) {
00316                 # END new
00317                     next unless $Record;
00318                     $writer->startTag("problem_user");
00319                     foreach my $field ($Record->FIELDS) {
00320                         # filter out the characters xml don't like
00321                         my $t = $Record->$field;
00322                         $t =~ s/([\x00-\x08\x0B-\x0C\x0E-\x1F])//g;
00323                         $writer->dataElement($field, $t);
00324                     }
00325                     $writer->endTag; # problem_user
00326                 }
00327             }
00328         }
00329         $writer->endTag; # problem_users
00330         delete $tables{problem_user}; # finished with that table
00331     }
00332     
00333     $writer->endTag; # webwork
00334     $writer->end;
00335     
00336     foreach my $table (keys %tables) {
00337         warn "skipped unknown table \"$table\".\n";
00338     }
00339     
00340     return ();
00341 }
00342 
00343 =item dbImport(%options)
00344 
00345 Imports the data from a WWDBv2 XML document into a WeBWorK database.
00346 
00347 In this version, the entire XML parse tree is held in RAM during the import.
00348 This can be very memory intensive for large import files.
00349 
00350 %options can contain:
00351 
00352 =over
00353 
00354 =item xml
00355 
00356 A string containing WWDBv2 XML data or a file handle opened for reading from a
00357 WWDBv2 XML document.
00358 
00359 =item db
00360 
00361 A WeBWorK::DB instance. Imported data will be added to this database.
00362 
00363 =item tables
00364 
00365 A reference to a list specifying the set of tables from which to import data.
00366 
00367 =item records
00368 
00369 Unimplemented.
00370 
00371 =item conflict
00372 
00373 A string, containing either "skip" or "replace", indicating what to do with
00374 duplicate records. If not set, duplicate records are skipped.
00375 
00376 =back
00377 
00378 =cut
00379 
00380 # DBFIXME this whole module is a MESS! we need efficient dump/restore functionality in the abstraction layer!
00381 sub dbImport {
00382     my (%options) = @_;
00383     
00384     croak "options: 'xml' required.\n" unless exists $options{xml};
00385     croak "options: 'db' required.\n" unless exists $options{db};
00386     
00387     my $replace = exists $options{conflict} && $options{conflict} eq "replace";
00388     
00389     my @tables = exists $options{tables} ? @{$options{tables}} : ();
00390     @tables = @TABLE_ORDER unless @tables;
00391     my %tables;
00392     @tables{@tables} = ();
00393     
00394     my ($parser, $tree);
00395     eval {
00396         $parser = new XML::Parser(Style => "EasyTree");
00397         $tree = $parser->parse($options{xml});
00398     };
00399     if ($@) {
00400         return "Failed to parse XML document: $@";
00401     }
00402     
00403     # find "webwork" node
00404     my ($root_element) = findNodes($tree, "e", "webwork");
00405     unless (defined $root_element) {
00406         return "Format error: 'webwork' element not found.";
00407     }
00408     
00409     # verify version
00410     unless (exists $root_element->{attrib}->{version}) {
00411         return "Version mismatch: XML document has no version attribute.";
00412     }
00413     unless ($root_element->{attrib}->{version} eq $DB_VERSION) {
00414         return "Version mismatch: XML document has version \""
00415             . $root_element->{attrib}->{version} . "\" (expected $DB_VERSION).";
00416     }
00417     
00418     my @nonfatal_errors;
00419     
00420     TABLE: foreach my $table (@TABLE_ORDER) {
00421         next TABLE unless exists $tables{$table}; # skip unrequested tables
00422         
00423         my ($table_element) = findNodes($root_element->{content}, "e", $table."s");
00424         unless ($table_element) {
00425             push @nonfatal_errors, "Format error: '${table}s' element not found.";
00426             next TABLE;
00427         }
00428         
00429         my $add_sub = $ADD_SUBS{$table};
00430         my $put_sub = $PUT_SUBS{$table};
00431         
00432         my @record_elements = findNodes($table_element->{content}, "e", $table);
00433         foreach my $record_element (@record_elements) {
00434             my $Record = $NEW_SUBS{$table}->($options{db});
00435             element2record($record_element, $Record);
00436             
00437             eval { $options{db}->$add_sub($Record) };
00438             if ($@) {
00439                 if ($@ =~ m/exists/) {
00440                     if ($replace) {
00441                         eval { $options{db}->$put_sub($Record) };
00442                         if ($@) {
00443                             push @nonfatal_errors, "$table record with @{[$Record->idsToString]} exists, failed to replace: $@";
00444                         }
00445                     } else {
00446                         push @nonfatal_errors, "$table record with @{[$Record->idsToString]} exists, skipping";
00447                     }
00448                 } else {
00449                     push @nonfatal_errors, "$table record with @{[$Record->idsToString]}: $@";
00450                 }
00451             }
00452         }
00453     }
00454     
00455     return @nonfatal_errors;
00456 }
00457 
00458 sub findNodes {
00459     my ($tree, $type, $name) = @_;
00460     my @found;
00461     foreach my $node (@$tree) {
00462         if ((not defined $type or $node->{type} eq $type)
00463                 and (not defined $name or $node->{name} eq $name)) {
00464             push @found, $node;
00465         }
00466     }
00467     return @found;
00468 }
00469 
00470 sub element2record {
00471     my ($element, $Record) = @_;
00472     my %fields;
00473     @fields{$Record->FIELDS} = ();
00474     
00475     foreach my $field_element (@{$element->{content}}) {
00476         my $type = $field_element->{type};
00477         my $name = $field_element->{name};
00478         unless ($type eq "e") {
00479             warn "found unexpected node of type '$type', ignoring.\n";
00480             next;
00481         }
00482         unless (exists $fields{$name}) {
00483             warn "found unexpected element with name '$name', ignoring.\n";
00484             next;
00485         }
00486         if ($fields{$name}) {
00487             warn "found duplicate element with name '$name', ignoring.\n";
00488             next;
00489         }
00490         
00491         $fields{$name}++;
00492         my ($content_node) = findNodes($field_element->{content}, "t", undef);
00493         unless ($content_node) {
00494             #warn "field element '$name' has no content, ignoring.\n";
00495             next;
00496         }
00497         $Record->$name($content_node->{content});
00498     }
00499     return $Record;
00500 }
